constructivist adjective
(ART)
Add to word list

art
  specialized (also Constructivist) relating to constructivism in art (= the idea that art should have a social purpose): Russian constructivist art
More examplesFewer examplesThe owners may just have liked Soviet constructivist art and thought it looks cool. My piece focused on how constructivist sculptors responded to the Russian Revolution.He took lessons from Constructivist painter Natalia Goncharova.The tower is a fantastic monument of Russian Constructivist architecture.
constructivist adjective
(EDUCATION)
education
  specialized relating to constructivism in education (= the idea that knowledge comes from experiences and ideas): The original strategy for presenting the course encouraged constructivist learning. See
constructivism
More examplesFewer examplesAccording to constructivist theories of learning, it is through the learner's activity that learning outcomes are achieved.A constructivist approach can be hard for students and their parents, who might need a lot of guidance in math.The website includes many resources for applying constructivist theory in maths and science.a constructivist textbook called "Mathematics in Context"

constructivist noun [C]
(ART)
art
  specialized (also Constructivist) someone who practises or believes in constructivism in art (= the idea that art should have a social purpose): It looks like something the Russian constructivists might have imagined.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are exceptional galleries of Dada and the Surrealists, Russian Constructivists, and Pop Art.The exhibition covers everything from the cool functionalism of the early Constructivists to the radical formal experiments of Konstantin Melnikov.
constructivist noun [C]
(EDUCATION)
education
  specialized someone who practises or believes in constructivism in education (= the idea that knowledge comes from experiences and ideas): The new curriculum divides the traditionalists and the constructivists. See
constructivism
More examplesFewer examplesConstructivists stress that students should be allowed to actively engage in the construction of knowledge.They insist schools are run by constructivists who have turned them into hotbeds of progressive thinking.
